column2: King Kaliko
column3: King Kaliko

column2: Don't worry, replied Quox.
column3: Don't worry, replied Quox.

column2: Next instant Shaggy was himself again and Quox said to him grumblingly:
column3: Next instant Shaggy was himself again and Quox said to him grumblingly:

column2: Please get off my left toe, Shaggy Man, and be more particular where you step.
column3: Please get off my left toe, Shaggy Man, and be more particular where you step.

column2: Quox did not have much to say until the conversation was ended, but then he turned to Kaliko and asked:
column3: Quox did not have much to say until the conversation was ended, but then he turned to Kaliko and asked:

column2: Me? stammered the Chamberlain, greatly surprised by the question. "Well, I couldn't be a worse King, I'm sure."
column3: Me? stammered the Chamberlain, greatly surprised by the question. "Well, I couldn't be a worse King, I'm sure."

column2: Of course, said Kaliko.
column3: Of course, said Kaliko.

column2: Hooray! cried Betsy; "I'm glad of that.
column3: Hooray! cried Betsy; "I'm glad of that.

column2: The Ugly One?	The Ugly One?
Very willingly," replied Kaliko.
column3: Very willingly," replied Kaliko.

column2: But is my dear brother well?" he added anxiously.
column3: But is my dear brother well?" he added anxiously.

column2: I hope he doesn't work too hard, said Shaggy.
column3: I hope he doesn't work too hard, said Shaggy.

column2: He doesn't work at all.	He doesn't work at all.
Not exactly, returned Kaliko.
column3: Not exactly, returned Kaliko.

column2: In the Metal Forest.
column3: In the Metal Forest.

column2: Where is that?
column3: Where is that?

column2: All the trees are gold and silver and the ground is strewn with precious stones, so it is a sort of treasury."
column3: All the trees are gold and silver and the ground is strewn with precious stones, so it is a sort of treasury."

column2: Kaliko hesitated.
column3: Kaliko hesitated.

column2: Do you suppose Ruggedo destroyed them?
column3: Do you suppose Ruggedo destroyed them?

column2: Oh, no; I'm quite sure he didn't.	Oh, no; I'm quite sure he didn't.

They fell into the big pit in the passage, and we put the cover on to keep them there; but when the executioners went to look for them they had all disappeared from the pit and we could find no trace of them."
column3: They fell into the big pit in the passage, and we put the cover on to keep them there; but when the executioners went to look for them they had all disappeared from the pit and we could find no trace of them."

column2: That's funny, remarked Betsy thoughtfully.
column3: That's funny, remarked Betsy thoughtfully.

column2: But to disappear like that seems like magic; now, doesn't it?"
column3: But to disappear like that seems like magic; now, doesn't it?"

column2: They agreed that it did, but no one could explain the mystery.
column3: They agreed that it did, but no one could explain the mystery.

column2: However, said Shaggy, "they are gone, that is certain, so we cannot help them or be helped by them.
column3: However, said Shaggy, "they are gone, that is certain, so we cannot help them or be helped by them.

column2: Betsy laughed and Shaggy seemed rather hurt; but Polychrome relieved his embarrassment by saying softly: "One can be ugly in looks, but lovely in disposition."
column3: Betsy laughed and Shaggy seemed rather hurt; but Polychrome relieved his embarrassment by saying softly: "One can be ugly in looks, but lovely in disposition."

column2: True, agreed Kaliko.
column3: True, agreed Kaliko.

column2: So I think I will assemble the chief nomes of my kingdom in this throne room and tell them that I am their new King. Then I can ask them to assist us in searching for the secret passages.	So I think I will assemble the chief nomes of my kingdom in this throne room and tell them that I am their new King. Then I can ask them to assist us in searching for the secret passages.
Of course not, said he, jumping up from the throne, where he had seated himself.
column3: Of course not, said he, jumping up from the throne, where he had seated himself.
